intro: Rubus cyclophyllus f. hulsenii, commonly known as the Hulsen's blackberry, is a subspecies of the blackberry plant native to parts of Europe. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
